returnType: The LOCALTIMESTAMP function returns a TIMESTAMP value.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL LOCALTIMESTAMP function returns the current date and time in the time zone of the current SQL session as set by the ALTER SESSION command. It returns a TIMESTAMP value.
sample:
ALTER SESSION SET TIME_ZONE = '-7:0'; select LOCALTIMESTAMP
from dual; 10-Sep-05 10.58.24 PM ALTER SESSION SET TIME_ZONE = '-2:0'; select LOCALTIMESTAMP
from dual; 10-Sep-05 03.58.24 AM
